responsibilities: Lead a team in the discovery, design, and delivery of data models, data governance models, data migration plans, data warehouse design, and reporting components of applications.
Work with Microsoft tools (.NET/SQL Server, SSIS/SSRS, MS Dynamics, Power BI), Tableau, Databricks, and Snowflake.
Develop an understanding of the core business functions of the client and bring innovative analytics solution ideas to support those functions.
Support all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL.
Perform analyses using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to deliver insights to decision-makers.
Focus on the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights.
skills: Proficiency in Microsoft tools (.NET/SQL Server, SSIS/SSRS, MS Dynamics, Power BI), Tableau, Databricks, and Snowflake.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Creativity and innovation with a desire to learn and apply new technologies, products, and libraries.
qualifications: Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.
10+ years of experience in data management, data modeling, data warehouse design, and/or data architecture.
10+ years of experience in cloud analytics (GCP, AWS, or Azure), Databricks.
5+ years of experience with Snowflake or other cloud data platforms.
5+ years of prior professional services or federal consulting experience (preferred).
